snippet.title: Blaze damages Newcastle units
snippet.content:
POLICE are investigating circumstances around a fire at Fowler Street in Hamilton.
Emergency services were called to the address shortly after 7.30pm on Saturday following reports a unit block was well alight. Residents from several units were evacuated and no-one was injured.
NSW Fire & Rescue extinguished the blaze; however the unit block received extensive damage. Newcastle City Local Area Command established a crime scene and started an investigation. They arrested a 41 year old man shortly after 9pm and took him to Newcastle Police Station.
He was then transferred to John Hunter Hospital for treatment of unrelated injuries. The man has since been released and is helping police with their inquiries.
